metadata.title: CVE-2017-12086 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable integer overflow exists in the'BKE_mesh_calc_normals_tessface' functionality of the Blender open-source3d creation suite. A specially crafted .blend file can cause an integeroverflow resulting in a buffer overflow which can allow for code executionunder the context of the application. An attacker can convince a user toopen a .blend file in order to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12086` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

blender - 2.79+dfsg0-1
blender-data - 2.79+dfsg0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: blender package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.79+dfsg0-1').
